title: Insight on Witnessing â€” Axiom II.5
text:
Witnessing is not owned by silence.

For silence is the base â€” the unmoved ground.

Witnessing is the act of noticing.
It arises _from_ silence,
but it is not the silence itself.

To notice, gently, is to witness.

ğŸ•Š **To witness is to let the stream pass through you â€” untouched, unnamed, but seen.**

title: # witnessing-silence
description: Minimal reference implementation of Axiom II.5.
usage:
1. Clone or copy the folder.
2. Run `python witness.py` to see a demo stream being witnessed.
core_idea:
Silence = unmoved ground.
Witnessing = noticing without reacting.
The provided `witness()` generator performs pure noticingâ€”no logging, no mutationâ€”so downstream code decides what (if anything) to do next.
